action-principle.name: Action Principle
action-principle.summary: Physical systems follow paths that minimize or maximize the action integral

assumptions.statement: Time is absolute and provides the integration variable for the action
assumptions.rationale: The action S = ∫L dt integrates over absolute time

analytical-mechanics.name: Analytical Mechanics
analytical-mechanics.summary: Reformulation of mechanics using variational principles and energy-based approaches

assumptions.statement: Time is absolute and global
assumptions.rationale: Analytical mechanics still operates within the framework of absolute time

black-holes.name: Black Holes
black-holes.summary: Regions of spacetime where gravity is so strong that nothing can escape

assumptions.statement: Matter can collapse to a point where the escape velocity exceeds the speed of light
assumptions.rationale: This follows from the Schwarzschild solution of the Einstein field equations

claims.statement: Black holes have an event horizon beyond which nothing can escape
Black holes emit Hawking radiation and can evaporate over time

classical-mechanics.name: Classical Mechanics
classical-mechanics.summary: Branch of physics that describes the motion of macroscopic objects under the influence of forces. Based on Newton's laws of motion and the assumption of absolute space and time.

assumptions.statement: Time is absolute and global - it flows uniformly and identically for all observers, regardless of their motion or position
assumptions.rationale: This fundamental assumption distinguishes classical mechanics from relativity, where time is relative. In classical mechanics, there is a universal 'now' that all observers share.

assumptions.statement: Space is absolute - it exists as a fixed, unchanging background independent of matter and energy
assumptions.rationale: Space is treated as a three-dimensional Euclidean space that provides the stage for physical events, but is not affected by them

assumptions.statement: Objects have definite positions and velocities that can be measured simultaneously with arbitrary precision
assumptions.rationale: Unlike quantum mechanics, classical mechanics assumes no fundamental uncertainty in position and momentum measurements

claims.statement: The laws of motion accurately describe the behavior of macroscopic objects at everyday speeds
Classical mechanics breaks down at very high speeds (approaching the speed of light) and for very small objects (atomic scale)

postulates.statement: Newton's First Law: An object at rest stays at rest, and an object in motion stays in motion at constant velocity, unless acted upon by an external force
Newton's Second Law: The acceleration of an object is directly proportional to the net force acting on it and inversely proportional to its mass (F = ma)
Newton's Third Law: For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction

conservation-of-energy.name: Conservation of Energy
conservation-of-energy.summary: Energy cannot be created or destroyed, only transformed from one form to another

assumptions.statement: Time is absolute and flows uniformly
assumptions.rationale: Energy conservation requires a consistent time coordinate across all observers

claims.statement: Total energy in an isolated system remains constant over time

conservation-of-momentum.name: Conservation of Momentum
conservation-of-momentum.summary: Total momentum of a closed system remains constant in the absence of external forces

assumptions.statement: Time is absolute and uniform
assumptions.rationale: Required for momentum conservation to hold consistently across all reference frames

claims.statement: Momentum is conserved in all closed systems

contracted-bianchi-identities.name: Contracted Bianchi Identities
contracted-bianchi-identities.summary: Fundamental differential identities in general relativity that ensure the Einstein tensor is divergence-free

claims.statement: The Einstein field equations automatically satisfy energy-momentum conservation without requiring it as a separate postulate

postulates.statement: The contracted Bianchi identities yield ∇_μ G^μν = 0, ensuring energy-momentum conservation

einstein-field-equations.name: Einstein Field Equations
einstein-field-equations.summary: Set of equations describing how matter and energy curve spacetime

assumptions.statement: The Einstein tensor G_μν is proportional to the stress-energy tensor T_μν
assumptions.rationale: This relates the geometry of spacetime (left side) to the matter-energy content (right side)

claims.statement: The field equations reduce to Newton's law of gravitation in the weak-field, low-velocity limit

postulates.statement: The contracted Bianchi identities ensure energy-momentum conservation: ∇_μ G^μν = 0

feynman-diagrams.name: Feynman Diagrams
feynman-diagrams.summary: Graphical representation of particle interactions in quantum field theory. Lines represent particles, vertices represent interactions, and diagrams encode the mathematical expressions for scattering amplitudes.

assumptions.statement: Particle interactions can be represented as diagrams with lines and vertices
assumptions.rationale: Feynman diagrams provide a visual and computational tool for calculating scattering amplitudes

claims.statement: Feynman diagrams simplify calculations of quantum field theory amplitudes

flrw-metric.name: FLRW Metric
flrw-metric.summary: Friedmann-Lemaître-Robertson-Walker metric describing a homogeneous, isotropic, expanding or contracting universe

assumptions.statement: The universe is homogeneous (uniform in space) and isotropic (looks the same in all directions)
assumptions.rationale: This cosmological principle simplifies the description of the large-scale universe

claims.statement: The universe can be described by a scale factor a(t) that evolves over time

general-relativity.name: General Relativity
general-relativity.summary: Theory of gravitation that describes gravity as the curvature of spacetime caused by matter and energy. Replaces Newton's law of universal gravitation and provides a geometric description of gravity.

assumptions.statement: Spacetime is a four-dimensional manifold that can be curved by the presence of matter and energy
assumptions.rationale: This geometric view of spacetime allows gravity to be described as curvature rather than a force

assumptions.statement: The laws of physics are the same in all inertial reference frames (principle of relativity)
assumptions.rationale: Extends special relativity to include accelerated frames and gravitational fields

assumptions.statement: The speed of light in vacuum is constant and independent of the motion of the source or observer
assumptions.rationale: Carried over from special relativity as a fundamental constant of nature

claims.statement: Light rays are bent by gravitational fields
Time passes more slowly in stronger gravitational fields (gravitational time dilation)
Gravitational waves exist and propagate at the speed of light
Black holes can form when matter collapses beyond its Schwarzschild radius
The universe can be described by cosmological models with a scale factor that evolves over time

postulates.statement: The equivalence principle: The effects of gravity are locally indistinguishable from the effects of acceleration
Spacetime curvature is determined by the distribution of matter and energy through the Einstein field equations: G_μν = 8πG/c⁴ T_μν
Free-falling objects follow geodesics (the shortest paths) in curved spacetime

hamiltonian-formulation.name: Hamiltonian Formulation
hamiltonian-formulation.summary: Mechanics expressed in terms of position and momentum coordinates

assumptions.statement: Time is absolute and global
assumptions.rationale: Hamilton's equations describe evolution with respect to absolute time

lagrangian-formulation.name: Lagrangian Formulation
lagrangian-formulation.summary: Mechanics reformulated using kinetic and potential energy in a single function

assumptions.statement: Time is absolute and flows uniformly
assumptions.rationale: The Lagrangian L(q, q̇, t) explicitly depends on time as an absolute parameter

lorentz-transformations.name: Lorentz Transformations
lorentz-transformations.summary: Mathematical transformations that relate space and time coordinates between different inertial reference frames

assumptions.statement: Spacetime uses Minkowski (hyperbolic) geometry
assumptions.rationale: Lorentz transformations preserve the Minkowski metric and are the isometries of hyperbolic spacetime

claims.statement: Lorentz transformations preserve the spacetime interval and the speed of light

minkowski-spacetime.name: Minkowski Spacetime
minkowski-spacetime.summary: Four-dimensional mathematical model combining three-dimensional space with time into a single continuum using hyperbolic geometry

assumptions.statement: Spacetime is a four-dimensional flat manifold with zero Riemann curvature and Minkowski (hyperbolic/Lorentzian) geometry
assumptions.rationale: The Minkowski metric uses hyperbolic geometry with signature (-, +, +, +), fundamentally different from Euclidean geometry. The spacetime interval is ds² = -c²dt² + dx² + dy² + dz². The Riemann curvature tensor is identically zero (R^μ_νρσ = 0), meaning the manifold has no intrinsic curvature - it is globally flat. The hyperbolic structure is a property of the entire spacetime, not just the time dimension, arising from the mixed signature that enables light cones and causality.

assumptions.statement: Time and space are unified into a single four-dimensional continuum
assumptions.rationale: Time is treated as a dimension on equal footing with spatial dimensions, but with opposite sign in the metric

claims.statement: The Minkowski metric provides the geometric foundation for special relativity

newtonian-mechanics.name: Newtonian Mechanics
newtonian-mechanics.summary: Mechanics based on Newton's three laws of motion and universal gravitation

assumptions.statement: Time is absolute and flows uniformly for all observers
assumptions.rationale: Fundamental to Newtonian mechanics - there is a universal time coordinate

assumptions.statement: Space is Euclidean and absolute
assumptions.rationale: Three-dimensional space follows Euclidean geometry and is independent of matter

claims.statement: Newton's laws accurately predict planetary motion and everyday mechanical phenomena

postulates.statement: Newton's Laws of Motion govern the motion of all objects
Universal Gravitation: Every particle attracts every other particle with a force proportional to their masses and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between them

newtons-laws-of-motion.name: Newton's Laws of Motion
newtons-laws-of-motion.summary: Three fundamental laws describing the relationship between motion and forces

assumptions.statement: Time is absolute and global - all observers measure the same time
assumptions.rationale: Essential for defining velocity and acceleration consistently across all reference frames

noethers-theorem.name: Noether's Theorem
noethers-theorem.summary: Fundamental theorem connecting symmetries to conservation laws. States that every differentiable symmetry of the action of a physical system corresponds to a conservation law.

assumptions.statement: Physical systems can be described by an action principle
assumptions.rationale: The theorem applies to systems with well-defined Lagrangians and actions

claims.statement: Time translation symmetry implies conservation of energy
Spatial translation symmetry implies conservation of momentum

path-integral-formulation.name: Path Integral Formulation
path-integral-formulation.summary: Alternative formulation of quantum mechanics that describes the probability amplitude for a particle to travel between two points as a sum over all possible paths. Each path contributes with a phase proportional to the action along that path. Equivalent to the Schrödinger equation but provides intuitive insights into quantum behavior.

assumptions.statement: All possible paths between two points contribute to the quantum amplitude
assumptions.rationale: The path integral sums over all possible paths, weighted by the action, to compute quantum amplitudes

assumptions.statement: Time is absolute in the path integral formulation (though paths can vary in time)
assumptions.rationale: The path integral integrates over paths in spacetime, treating time as a parameter

claims.statement: The path integral formulation is equivalent to the Schrödinger equation
Path integrals provide intuitive visualization of quantum interference

quantum-computing.name: Quantum Computing
quantum-computing.summary: Computing paradigm that uses quantum mechanical phenomena like superposition and entanglement to perform computations. Feynman proposed using quantum systems to simulate quantum physics.

assumptions.statement: Quantum systems can be used to perform computations more efficiently than classical computers for certain problems
assumptions.rationale: Quantum superposition and entanglement provide computational advantages for specific algorithms

claims.statement: Quantum computers can simulate quantum systems efficiently

quantum-electrodynamics.name: Quantum Electrodynamics
quantum-electrodynamics.summary: Quantum field theory of electromagnetism describing interactions of light and matter. The most precisely tested theory in physics, with predictions verified to extraordinary accuracy.

assumptions.statement: Electromagnetic field is quantized and interacts with charged particles
assumptions.rationale: QED treats the electromagnetic field as a quantum field with photons as quanta

assumptions.statement: Spacetime uses Minkowski (hyperbolic) geometry
assumptions.rationale: QED operates in flat Minkowski spacetime consistent with special relativity

claims.statement: QED predicts the anomalous magnetic moment of the electron with extraordinary precision
Feynman diagrams provide a visual representation of particle interactions

postulates.statement: The interaction between charged particles and photons is described by the QED Lagrangian

quantum-field-theory.name: Quantum Field Theory
quantum-field-theory.summary: Theoretical framework combining quantum mechanics with special relativity to describe how fields and particles interact. Provides the foundation for understanding fundamental forces and particles.

assumptions.statement: Fields are the fundamental entities, and particles are excitations of these fields
assumptions.rationale: Quantum field theory treats particles as quantized excitations of underlying fields rather than point particles

assumptions.statement: Spacetime uses Minkowski (hyperbolic) geometry from special relativity
assumptions.rationale: QFT operates in flat Minkowski spacetime, requiring the hyperbolic geometry structure

claims.statement: Quantum field theory successfully describes particle creation and annihilation

postulates.statement: Fields obey quantum mechanical principles and special relativity

relativistic-dynamics.name: Relativistic Dynamics
relativistic-dynamics.summary: Study of motion under the influence of forces, incorporating relativistic corrections

assumptions.statement: Spacetime uses Minkowski (hyperbolic) geometry
assumptions.rationale: Relativistic dynamics requires the hyperbolic metric structure of Minkowski spacetime

relativistic-kinematics.name: Relativistic Kinematics
relativistic-kinematics.summary: Study of motion in the absence of forces, accounting for relativistic effects

assumptions.statement: Spacetime follows Minkowski (hyperbolic) geometry
assumptions.rationale: Relativistic kinematics is based on the hyperbolic geometry of Minkowski spacetime

relativistic-mechanics.name: Relativistic Mechanics
relativistic-mechanics.summary: Mechanics reformulated to account for relativistic effects at high velocities

renormalization.name: Renormalization
renormalization.summary: Mathematical procedure to remove infinities from quantum field theory calculations by redefining physical parameters. Essential for making QED and other quantum field theories produce finite, meaningful predictions.

assumptions.statement: Divergent integrals in quantum field theory can be systematically removed
assumptions.rationale: Renormalization provides a procedure to absorb infinities into redefinition of physical parameters

claims.statement: Renormalization makes QED predictions finite and accurate

ricci-curvature.name: Ricci Curvature
ricci-curvature.summary: Mathematical tensor that measures the degree to which the geometry of a space differs from that of flat Euclidean space

claims.statement: The Ricci tensor is a contraction of the Riemann curvature tensor

riemann-curvature-tensor.name: Riemann Curvature Tensor
riemann-curvature-tensor.summary: Fundamental tensor in differential geometry that completely characterizes the intrinsic curvature of a manifold

assumptions.statement: Space can be described as a differentiable manifold with a metric tensor
assumptions.rationale: This allows the application of differential geometry to describe curved spaces

claims.statement: The Riemann tensor measures the failure of parallel transport to be path-independent

special-relativity.name: Special Relativity
special-relativity.summary: Theory of physics that describes the relationship between space and time in inertial reference frames. Based on the constancy of the speed of light and the principle of relativity.

assumptions.statement: Spacetime is flat with zero Riemann curvature and uses Minkowski geometry (hyperbolic/Lorentzian geometry) with metric signature (-, +, +, +)
assumptions.rationale: Special relativity assumes flat spacetime with hyperbolic geometry, where the spacetime interval ds² = -c²dt² + dx² + dy² + dz². The Riemann curvature tensor is identically zero (R^μ_νρσ = 0), meaning spacetime has no intrinsic curvature. The hyperbolic nature is a property of the entire 4D spacetime manifold (not just the time dimension), arising from the mixed signature that distinguishes time from space. This is fundamentally different from Euclidean geometry used in classical mechanics.

assumptions.statement: The laws of physics are the same in all inertial reference frames (principle of relativity)
assumptions.rationale: No preferred inertial frame exists; physics is the same for all observers moving at constant velocity relative to each other

assumptions.statement: The speed of light in vacuum is constant and independent of the motion of the source or observer
assumptions.rationale: This fundamental postulate leads to time dilation, length contraction, and the relativity of simultaneity

assumptions.statement: Time is relative - there is no absolute, global time. Simultaneity is relative to the observer's reference frame
assumptions.rationale: In contrast to classical mechanics, special relativity shows that time flows differently for observers in relative motion

claims.statement: Length contraction: Objects in motion appear shorter in the direction of motion
Relativity of simultaneity: Events that are simultaneous in one frame are not simultaneous in another frame moving relative to the first
Mass-energy equivalence: E = mc²

postulates.statement: The principle of relativity: The laws of physics are identical in all inertial frames of reference
The constancy of the speed of light: The speed of light in vacuum is the same for all observers, regardless of the motion of the light source or observer

predictions.statement: Time dilation: Moving clocks run slower than stationary clocks
predictions.verification_method: Hafele-Keating experiment with atomic clocks on airplanes

twin-paradox.name: Twin Paradox
twin-paradox.summary: Thought experiment demonstrating time dilation where a traveling twin ages slower than a stationary twin

assumptions.statement: Time is relative and spacetime uses Minkowski (hyperbolic) geometry
assumptions.rationale: The twin paradox demonstrates the non-Euclidean nature of time in Minkowski spacetime

claims.statement: A traveling twin will age less than a stationary twin due to time dilation

universal-gravitation.name: Universal Gravitation
universal-gravitation.summary: Every particle attracts every other particle with a force proportional to their masses

assumptions.statement: Gravitational force acts instantaneously across any distance
assumptions.rationale: Assumes action at a distance without propagation delay, in contrast to general relativity where gravity propagates at the speed of light

claims.statement: Gravitational force follows an inverse-square law: F = G(m₁m₂)/r²

einstein-1905-relativity.title: On the Electrodynamics of Moving Bodies

einstein-1915-foundation.title: On the General Theory of Relativity

feynman-1948-path-integral.title: A Relativistic Cut-Off for Classical Electrodynamics

ricci-1904-absolute-calculus.title: Méthodes de calcul différentiel absolu et leurs applications

riemann-1854-geometry.title: On the Hypotheses Which Lie at the Bases of Geometry

force.name: force
force.explanation: Theories and concepts related to forces, including gravitational, electromagnetic, and nuclear forces

gravity.name: gravity
gravity.explanation: Theories and phenomena related to gravitational interactions

spacetime.name: spacetime
spacetime.explanation: Concepts related to the four-dimensional fabric of space and time

time.name: time
time.explanation: Concepts related to time, time evolution, and temporal dynamics

cosmic-blueshift.name: Cosmic Blueshift Anomaly
cosmic-blueshift.description:
While most distant galaxies show redshift due to cosmic expansion (Hubble's law),
some observations have reported unexpected blueshifts or anomalous redshift patterns
that cannot be explained by simple Hubble flow. These include local blueshifts in
certain galaxy clusters, anomalous redshift quantization, and discrepancies between
predicted and observed redshifts. This challenges the assumption of uniform cosmic
expansion and the FLRW cosmological model.
cosmic-blueshift.explanation:
Most blueshift observations are explained by local peculiar velocities (galaxies moving
within clusters) rather than cosmic expansion. However, some anomalous redshift patterns
remain unexplained and may indicate large-scale structure effects, modified gravity,
or systematic measurement errors. The redshift quantization claims remain controversial
and unverified by mainstream cosmology.

violated_assumptions.violation_description: The FLRW metric assumes uniform cosmic expansion, but blueshift observations and anomalous redshift patterns suggest possible local deviations, large-scale structure effects, or violations of the cosmological principle

hubble-tension.name: Hubble Tension
hubble-tension.description:
A significant discrepancy between measurements of the Hubble constant (H₀) from early
universe observations (cosmic microwave background, CMB) and late universe observations
(Type Ia supernovae, Cepheid variables). Early universe measurements suggest H₀ ≈ 67 km/s/Mpc,
while late universe measurements suggest H₀ ≈ 73 km/s/Mpc. This ~5-10% tension challenges
the standard ΛCDM cosmological model and suggests possible new physics or systematic errors.

violated_assumptions.violation_description: The FLRW metric assumes a homogeneous and isotropic universe, but the Hubble tension suggests possible spatial variations, evolution of dark energy, or new physics that breaks the cosmological principle

mercury-perihelion-precession.name: Mercury's Perihelion Precession
mercury-perihelion-precession.description:
The observed precession of Mercury's perihelion (the point of closest approach to the Sun)
was approximately 43 arcseconds per century more than could be explained by Newtonian
mechanics, even accounting for perturbations from other planets. This anomaly challenged
Newton's theory of gravitation and was one of the key pieces of evidence that led to
the development of general relativity.

violated_assumptions.violation_description: Newtonian mechanics assumes gravitational force acts instantaneously and follows an exact inverse square law, but Mercury's orbit shows additional precession that cannot be explained by this assumption alone

michelson-morley-null-result.name: Michelson-Morley Null Result
michelson-morley-null-result.description:
The Michelson-Morley experiment attempted to detect the motion of Earth through the
hypothetical luminiferous ether by measuring the speed of light in different directions.
The experiment found no difference in the speed of light regardless of direction,
contradicting the ether theory and leading to the development of special relativity.

violated_assumptions.violation_description: Classical mechanics assumes time is absolute, but the Michelson-Morley experiment's null result showed that the speed of light is constant in all directions, contradicting the assumption of absolute time and space

pioneer-anomaly.name: Pioneer Anomaly
pioneer-anomaly.description:
The Pioneer 10 and Pioneer 11 spacecraft exhibited an unexplained constant acceleration
towards the Sun of approximately 8.74 × 10⁻¹⁰ m/s². This anomalous acceleration was
observed over decades of tracking data and could not be explained by known forces,
including solar radiation pressure, general relativity effects, or spacecraft systematics.
The anomaly challenged our understanding of gravity in the outer solar system.
pioneer-anomaly.explanation:
Year: 2012. The anomaly was largely resolved through detailed analysis showing that
anisotropic thermal radiation from the spacecraft's radioisotope thermoelectric generators
and electrical systems provided the missing acceleration. However, some residual
unexplained acceleration may still exist, suggesting possible new physics or incomplete
understanding of thermal effects.

violated_assumptions.violation_description: General relativity assumes that all accelerations can be explained by spacetime curvature and known forces, but the Pioneer anomaly suggested an unexplained acceleration that might indicate new physics or incomplete understanding of gravity at large distances

ultraviolet-catastrophe.name: Ultraviolet Catastrophe
ultraviolet-catastrophe.description:
Classical statistical mechanics predicted that a blackbody should emit infinite energy
at high frequencies (ultraviolet and beyond), which contradicted experimental observations.
This anomaly showed that classical physics could not explain blackbody radiation and
led to the development of quantum mechanics.

violated_assumptions.violation_description: Classical mechanics assumes energy can be distributed continuously among all possible frequencies, but this leads to infinite energy at high frequencies (ultraviolet catastrophe), contradicting observations

kyoto-basic-sciences.name: Kyoto Prize in Basic Sciences
kyoto-basic-sciences.description: Awarded annually by the Inamori Foundation for outstanding contributions to basic sciences

nobel-chemistry.name: Nobel Prize in Chemistry
nobel-chemistry.description: Awarded annually by the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences for outstanding contributions to chemistry

nobel-economics.name: Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences
nobel-economics.description: Awarded annually by the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences for outstanding contributions to economic sciences

nobel-medicine.name: Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine
nobel-medicine.category: Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine
nobel-medicine.description: Awarded annually by the Nobel Assembly at Karolinska Institutet for outstanding contributions to physiology or medicine

nobel-physics.name: Nobel Prize in Physics
nobel-physics.description: Awarded annually by the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences for outstanding contributions to physics

nobel-chemistry-1911.description: For the discovery of the elements radium and polonium

nobel-medicine-1962.description: For their discoveries concerning the molecular structure of nucleic acids and its significance for information transfer in living material

nobel-physics-1902.description: Influence of magnetism upon radiation phenomena

nobel-physics-1918.description: For the services he rendered to the advancement of Physics by his discovery of energy quanta

nobel-physics-1921.description: For his services to Theoretical Physics, and especially for his discovery of the law of the photoelectric effect

nobel-physics-1922.description: For his services in the investigation of the structure of atoms and of the radiation emanating from them

nobel-physics-1929.description: For his discovery of the wave nature of electrons

nobel-physics-1932.description: For the creation of quantum mechanics

nobel-physics-1933.description: For the discovery of new productive forms of atomic theory

nobel-physics-1965.description: Fundamental work in quantum electrodynamics, with deep-ploughing consequences for the physics of elementary particles

nobel-physics-1979.description: For their contributions to the theory of the unified weak and electromagnetic interaction between elementary particles

nobel-physics-2017.description: For decisive contributions to the LIGO detector and the observation of gravitational waves

nobel-physics-2020.description: For the discovery that black hole formation is a robust prediction of the general theory of relativity
